title: Need help with 20s font
content:
Can anyone help me find this font? I am trying to match it for a class project.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Aux Elegantes\_font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105445/http:/typophile.com/files/Aux%20Elegantes_font.jpg) | 64.18 KB |

 [‹ NFL Typeface seen on Combine Jerseys and Sideline Gear](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105445/http:/typophile.com/node/50218 "Go to previous forum topic") [This light elegant slab ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105445/http:/typophile.com/node/50216 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Quintessa

comments.content:
I guess you really do not want to hear that it is hand lettered.

Michael
Yes, I had figured that it was. But if possible, I would like to find something close.
Nick Curtis might have something close. [http://www.nicksfonts.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105445/http:/www.nicksfonts.com/)

I can think of 2 serif fonts with E’s like this: [Eplica](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105445/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/eplica/) and [Aquamarine](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105445/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/psyops/aquamarine_smallercaps_roman_ligatures/). (I think Aquamarine has alternate letters that may match the A better.)

Some other fonts, like [Hollandse Mediaeval](http://web.archive.org/web/20081210105445/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/cg_hollandse_mediaeval_signature_virtual/), might match the other letters better.

- Mike Yanega
